remarks: If the converse of a relation ` A ` is a function, exactly one point of its graph has a given second element (that is, function value) (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 1-Apr-2018.)
statement:
fcnvgreu $p |- ( ( ( Rel A /\ Fun `' A ) /\ Y e. ran A ) -> E! p e. A Y = ( 2nd ` p ) ) $.
$d A p $.
$d Y p $.
